Package main

Class CommandLine

java.lang.Object
main.CommandLine
public class CommandLine extends Object
This class launches the CMD game and manages the player input and written output.
Author:
Farzad and Daniel

  • Constructor Details

    • CommandLine

      public CommandLine()
      Creates a new CommandLine object. Start the command line game.

  • Method Details

    • getScanner

      public Scanner getScanner()
      Get the value of scanner
      Returns:
      the value of scanner

    • setScanner

      public void setScanner(Scanner scanner)
      set the value of scanner
      Parameters:
      scanner - the new value of scanner

    • start

      public void start()
      Ask the player if they want to play or not. If yes, then run the command line game setup. If no, then quit the game.

    • setupCmdGame

      public void setupCmdGame()
      Setup the command line game. 1. Set the player name. 2. Set the number of days. 3. Set the difficulty. 4. Run game setup to populate necessary game information. 5. Select a starting monster.

    • selectPlayerName

      public void selectPlayerName()
      Ask the player to pick a player name. The name must be between 3 to 15 characters long and contain no numbers or special characters.

    • selectNumDays

      public void selectNumDays()
      Ask the player to pick a number of days to play for. The number of days must be between 5 to 15 days.

    • selectDifficulty

      public void selectDifficulty()
      Ask the player to pick a difficulty. The options are Easy, Normal, or Hard.

    • selectStartingMonster

      public void selectStartingMonster()
      Print a list of all monsters and ask the player to pick a starting monster. The choices are Average Joe, Chunky, Lanky, Shanny, Raka, or Zap.

    • selectMonsterName

      public void selectMonsterName(Monster monster)
      Rename of the given monster The monster name must be between 3 to 15 characters long and contain no numbers or special characters.
      Parameters:
      monster - the monster to be renamed

    • viewShop

      public void viewShop()
      Print the shop contents and allow the user to either view a monster, view an item, or go back to the home page.

    • viewShopMonster

      public void viewShopMonster(Monster monster)
      Print the full details of the given monster and allow the user to either buy or go back to the shop page.
      Parameters:
      monster - the given monster

    • viewShopItem

      public void viewShopItem(Item item)
      Print the full details of the given item and allow the user to either buy or go back to the shop page.
      Parameters:
      item - the given item

    • viewTeam

      public void viewTeam()
      Print a list of the player's monsters and allow them to either view a monster or go back to the home page.

    • viewPlayerMonster

      public void viewPlayerMonster(Monster monster)
      Print the full details of the given monster and allow the user to either rename, sell, or go back to my team page.
      Parameters:
      monster - the given monster

    • viewInventory

      public void viewInventory()
      Print a list of the player's items and allow them to either view an item or go back to the home page.

    • viewPlayerItem

      public void viewPlayerItem(Item item)
      Print the full details of the given item and allow the user to either use, sell, or go back to my inventory page.
      Parameters:
      item - the given item

    • useItem

      public void useItem(Item item)
      Print the player's team and allow the user to pick a monster to either apply the item to or go back to the item page.
      Parameters:
      item - the given item

    • viewBattles

      public void viewBattles()
      Print a list of all the battles and allow the user to either view a battle or go back to the home page.

    • viewBattle

      public void viewBattle(Battle battle)
      Print the full details of the given battle and allow the user to either fight the battle or go back the battles page.
      Parameters:
      battle - the given battle

    • playBattle

      public void playBattle(Battle battle)
      Play the given battle using command line to control the pace of the battle. The player must press Enter to play the next turn in the battle and continue until the battle is over. Checks the player team before the game to make sure they have at least one non fainted monster. Checks the status of the battle after each turn.
      Parameters:
      battle - the given battle currently being played

    • viewStats

      public void viewStats()
      Print the game statistics and allow the player to go back to the home page.

    • printStats

      public void printStats()
      Print the following: 1. Balance 2. Player name 3. The current day 4. Difficulty 5. Today's score and total score 6. Today's battles won and total battles won

    • viewSleep

      public void viewSleep()
      Print the events that occurred over night and allow the user to go back to the home page.

    • goBack

      public void goBack()
      Allow the player to go back to the previous page by entering a certain key. This method can be added to an other method in order to add a go back buffer.

    • viewHome

      public void viewHome()
      Print a list of the home page menu.

    • run

      public void run()
      Print the home page and run the main command line loop. The loop continues until the game has finished. The final stats will be printed once the loop has stopped.

    • properCase

      public String properCase(String phrase)
      Returns a proper case version of the given phrase with the first letter of each word in upper case and all redundant whitespace removed.
      Parameters:
      phrase - to be formatted
      Returns:
      the formatted phrase

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      the main call to start the command line game
      Parameters:
      args - the command line arguments
